metadata.synopsis: Players find Dammon in HAV or LOW for the first or second time in the game with Karlach in your party. He will say that he knows a way to upgrade Karlach for the first or second time, depending on how her origin story evolved.
metadata.how_to_trigger: With Karlach in your party as an avatar or a companion (far from the party):- Load SCL_Main_A- Set up the tiefling path using the debug book- Speak with Dammon.or- Load CTY_Main_A- goto -7; 40; 5- Speak with Dammon.

1.speaker: Dammon
1.text: Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. What are you doing here?
1.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

147.speaker: Karlach
147.text: Same thing as you, I reckon. Trying to stay out of the shadows.
147.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

144.speaker: Karlach
144.text: Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus. Not too different from my own story.
144.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

250.speaker: Karlach
250.text: Well done making it out alive.
250.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

96.speaker: Dammon
96.text: Same to you. Though unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you. Infernal engine?
96.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: Who needs a heart when you've got one of these to keep you warm. Thank you, Zariel.
88.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

162.speaker: Dammon
162.text: Forget warm - you're burning up. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: Please do. I've been dying to find an infernal mechanic.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

237.speaker: Dammon
237.text: Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.

177.speaker: Dammon
177.text: I could try to sort you out, but I'll need some infernal iron and a lot of luck.

198.speaker: Karlach
198.text: Infernal iron, eh? I can swing that. Will come back with command in tow and take it from there. Thanks, Dammon - you don't know what this means.

70.speaker: Dammon
70.text: I sensed some iron in the area when we arrived here - but I'm not sure if it's still there, now that we've been holed up. But I'll show you where I'd look.

11.speaker: Dammon
11.text: Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.

262.speaker: Dammon
262.text: Gods, I'm glad to see you again. There's something I have to tell you.

18.speaker: Dammon
18.text: There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

13.speaker: Dammon
13.text: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.

150.speaker: Dammon
150.text: Well... two things. Good news and bad news.

7.speaker: Dammon
7.text: I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for you to - well, touch people.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: That's all I needed to hear. I'll be back with some infernal iron.

112.speaker: Dammon
112.text: Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.

216.speaker: Karlach
216.text: Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: You think wrong! Thanks Dammon; I'll be back.

160.speaker: Dammon
160.text: Well - all right. But don't be long, Karlach.

166.speaker: Karlach
166.text: Head off before he can say another word.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: I've got the iron right here. Let's make this happen.

154.speaker: Dammon
154.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

77.speaker: Dammon
77.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

79.speaker: Dammon
79.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

90.speaker: Dammon
90.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

248.speaker: Karlach
248.text: Any idea where I should look for the last piece?

252.speaker: Dammon
252.text: I sensed some in the area when we arrived here - but I'm not sure if it's still there, now that we've been holed up. But I'll show you where I'd look.

253.speaker: Karlach
253.text: That's amazing! How did you figure it out?

64.speaker: Dammon
64.text: Pure tiefling ingenuity. That engine of yours is like nothing I've ever encountered - hard to change, but possible to... enhance.

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: Good news is my favourite kind.

23.speaker: Dammon
23.text: There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: Dammon! Thank the gods. I've been looking for you everywhere.

0.speaker: Dammon
0.text: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.

20.speaker: Dammon
20.text: I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for you to -

94.speaker: Dammon
94.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

85.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. I'll be back as soon as I've got the goods in tow.
85.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. I'll be back as soon as I've got the goods in tow.
114.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

86.speaker: Dammon
86.text: Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.

68.speaker: Dammon
68.text: Karlach, believe me, this isn't something you should -

260.speaker: Karlach
260.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. Just a sec - let me find my pals. I'll be right back!
260.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

42.speaker: Dammon
42.text: Argh - at least let me show you where to look. I'm not sure the infernal iron will still be there, but I can show you a few places of interest.
42.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

24.speaker: Dammon
24.text: There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

26.speaker: Dammon
26.text: Dammon! Thank the gods. I've been looking for you everywhere.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: Dammon! Thank the gods. I've been looking for you everywhere.

180.speaker: Dammon
180.text: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.

43.speaker: Dammon
43.text: Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.

34.speaker: Dammon
34.text: Off the anvil, into the forge. We'll find them - hopefully.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: Off the anvil, into the forge. We'll find them - hopefully.

12.speaker: Dammon
12.text: Before you run off into the belly of the beast, there's something I need to tell you.

183.speaker: Dammon
183.text: Well... two things. Good news and bad news.

202.speaker: Dammon
202.text: I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for Karlach to -

99.speaker: Dammon
99.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

200.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. So c'mon, let's get this show on the road - we need to find that iron!
200.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. So c'mon, let's get this show on the road - we need to find that iron!
28.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

189.speaker: Dammon
189.text: Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.

228.speaker: Karlach
228.text: Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.

182.speaker: Dammon
182.text: Karlach, believe me, this isn't something you should -

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. We've got the iron - let's do this thing!
84.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: Yeah, sure, but first - fix me. Please.
73.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Go on, give him the iron. Let's make this happen.
66.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

80.speaker: Dammon
80.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

203.speaker: Dammon
203.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

229.speaker: Dammon
229.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

67.speaker: Dammon
67.text: Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Let's let Dammon speak. This sounds important.
49.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

214.speaker: Karlach
214.context: NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

117.speaker: Dammon
117.text: I don't enjoy saying this, Karlach, but there's no two ways about it: your engine is going to blow, and I can't fix it. I'm not sure anyone can.

32.speaker: Dammon
32.text: It's simply too hot to exist here in the material plane. Unless you return to Avernus - for good - this thing is going to blow. Sooner rather than later.

175.speaker: Karlach
175.text: But - but still, you can give me something that'll let me touch again, right? Safely?

223.speaker: Karlach
223.text: That's all I need to know. Do it. Please.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Karlach, did you hear what Dammon said? Your engine is going to explode - soon.

145.speaker: Karlach
145.text: I never wanted to live forever. I just want to live good.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: This can wait - we have more important things to handle first.

164.speaker: Karlach
164.text: Nothing is more important than this. Not to me.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It can wait and so can you.

136.speaker: Karlach
136.text: Ew, no! Good news, please, my good man.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Which do you want to hear first, Karlach?

55.speaker: Dammon
55.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.text: Would be a lot better if you'd find a way to fix this engine, Dammon.
143.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

240.speaker: Dammon
240.text: I haven't stopped trying, but all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -
240.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: Never mind. I'm glad you're set up for the long run, in any case. One of us should be.

125.speaker: Dammon
125.text: It's the best situation I've had in years, honestly. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.

17.speaker: Dammon
17.text: I... I don't know how this is going to end for you. For any of us, really. But I know I'd be dead without you, several times over.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Thanks to you, I'm feeling well.
75.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

142.speaker: Dammon
142.text: Couldn't be happier to hear that.

104.speaker: Karlach
104.text: Glad to see you're so well set-up here.
104.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

38.speaker: Dammon
38.text: Best I've had in years. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.
38.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

87.speaker: Dammon
87.text: I haven't stopped trying to think of something that could help your engine last it out, by the way. But so far, all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -
87.context: NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

213.speaker: Karlach
213.text: Never mind. I'm glad you're set up for the long run, in any case. One of us should be.

153.speaker: Dammon
153.text: Thanks, Karlach. I... I don't know how this is going to end for you. For any of us, really. But I know I'd be dead without you, several times over.

236.speaker: Dammon
236.text: In another life, I would've liked to... well. It doesn't matter now. Good luck, Karlach. And thank you. Again.

61.speaker: Dammon
61.text: Heavens above - there you are, Karlach! I was so hoping you'd come find me. I saw you you lot in Last Light, but didn't want to distract you from the fight against Ketheric.
61.context: NodeContext: Good natured but sincere longing for a solution

234.speaker: Dammon
234.text: Thank you for saving us - again.

155.speaker: Karlach
155.text: Wouldn't leave you folks behind - not ever.

82.speaker: Dammon
82.text: Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.
82.context: NodeContext: Good natured but sincere longing for a solution

91.speaker: Dammon
91.context: NodeContext: Good natured but sincere longing for a solution

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: Never mind. Glad you're all right in any case. Nice forge you've got here.
221.context: NodeContext: Warmly with ab ittersweet twist. She's glad Dammon is happy but sorry he can't fix her.

60.context: NodeContext: Warmly with ab ittersweet twist. She's glad Dammon is happy but sorry he can't fix her.

215.context: NodeContext: Warmly with ab ittersweet twist. She's glad Dammon is happy but sorry he can't fix her.

83.speaker: Dammon
83.text: Take a look at what I've got on offer, while you're here. Might be you find something useful to you.

127.speaker: Dammon
127.text: Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. What are you doing here?
127.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

264.speaker: Dammon
264.text: Same thing as you, I reckon. Trying to stay out of the shadows.
264.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

111.speaker: Karlach
111.text: Same thing as you, I reckon. Trying to stay out of the shadows.
111.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.text: Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus. Not too different from my own story.
226.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: Well done making it out alive.
210.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

176.speaker: Dammon
176.text: Same to you. Though unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you. Infernal engine?
176.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: Who needs a heart when you've got one of these to keep you warm. Thank you, Zariel.
6.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

130.speaker: Dammon

231.speaker: Dammon
231.text: Now that's hot. Too hot. I think I could sort you out, but I'll need some infernal iron and a lot of luck.

134.speaker: Karlach
134.text: Hey soldier - we've got some infernal iron already. Let's give it to him, hey?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Absolutely - let's see what his upgrade involves.

4.speaker: Dammon
4.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

113.speaker: Dammon
113.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

205.speaker: Dammon
205.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

98.speaker: Dammon
98.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I'm not sure. Should we be tampering with an infernal machine?

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: Yes. Yes we should. I feel like I'm about to blow in more ways than one.

267.speaker: Player
267.text: If you're sure, then let's do it.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Let's think about it first - we don't want to do something we can't take back.

251.speaker: Karlach
251.text: Yes we do. We absolutely do. I need help, and I'm going to get it. Got it?

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Fall in line. We have higher priorities.

188.speaker: Dammon
188.text: Sure. Meantime, if you need to stock up, everything I have is available.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Any idea where we can find some infernal iron?

191.speaker: Dammon
191.text: As a matter of fact, I think I might. I've sensed some in the area. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.

218.speaker: Dammon
218.text: Shout if you need anything else.

37.speaker: Dammon
37.text: Shout if you need anything else.

138.speaker: Dammon
138.text: Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

139.speaker: Dammon
139.text: Well... two things. Good news and bad news.

271.text: Thank you for saving us - again.

115.text: Thank you for saving us - again.

169.speaker: Karlach
169.text: Wouldn't leave you folks behind - not ever.

217.speaker: Dammon

217.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

224.speaker: Dammon
224.text: Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. Karlach, right? Without you lot, I'd've been toast twice over. First in the druid's grove, then at Last Light Inn.
224.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

245.speaker: Dammon
245.text: Thank you for saving my life. But I have to ask... what are you doing here?

54.speaker: Dammon
54.text: Thank you for saving my life. But I have to ask... what are you doing here?

167.speaker: Karlach
167.text: We have business in the city. Same as you, by the looks of things. Nice forge you have here.

225.speaker: Dammon
225.text: Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.
225.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

171.speaker: Dammon
171.text: Barely. Many of us weren't so lucky. We were ambushed by cultists. Those of us who didn't fall in the fight were dragged off - a few of us fled and made it here.

246.speaker: Karlach
246.text: That's terrible. If we can help them, we will.

184.speaker: Dammon
184.text: I can still help with that upgrade, if you've found some infernal iron.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: I'll come back when I've got the iron and my team in tow. They'll definitely want to see what happens!

232.speaker: Dammon
232.text: Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. Karlach, right? Without you lot, I'd've been toast twice over. First in the druid's grove, then at Last Light Inn.

185.speaker: Dammon
185.text: Thank you for all you've done for us - for me. But I have to ask... what are you doing here?
185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

128.text: We have business in the city. Same as you, by the looks of things. Nice forge you have here.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

48.speaker: Dammon
48.text: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose - hey... do I smell infernal iron?

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: I have business in this cursed wasteland, if you can believe it.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

270.speaker: Dammon
270.text: There's little I don't believe any more. For example... is that infernal iron I smell?

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

33.speaker: Dammon
33.text: You must have a similar story. Unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

72.speaker: Dammon
72.text: Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

121.speaker: Dammon
121.text: Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.

45.speaker: Dammon
45.text: I could try to sort you out, but I'll need some infernal iron and a lot of luck.

132.speaker: Karlach
132.text: In fact, I've got a piece on me now. Let's do this.

65.speaker: Dammon
65.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

69.speaker: Dammon
69.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

242.speaker: Dammon
242.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

208.speaker: Dammon
208.text: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

53.speaker: Dammon
53.text: I should be thanking you. I'd love to get my hands on something other than pauper's ore...

148.speaker: Karlach
148.text: Any idea where I can score some infernal iron?

95.speaker: Dammon
95.text: As a matter of fact, I think I might. I've sensed some in the area. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.

195.speaker: Karlach
195.text: Looking for help with this hot tin tub I call my heart.

35.speaker: Dammon
35.text: I thought I smelled infernal iron.

255.speaker: Dammon
255.text: Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.

265.speaker: Dammon
265.text: Barely. Many of us weren't so lucky. We were ambushed by cultists. Those of us who didn't fall in the fight were dragged off - a few of us fled and made it here.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: That's terrible. If we can help them, we will.

152.speaker: Dammon
152.text: I can still help with that upgrade, if you've found some infernal iron.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

266.speaker: Dammon
266.text: Thought I sensed an infernal around here. I wanted to introduce myself after you helped us in the druid's grove, but I didn't get the chance.
